text: there's more good days than bad days for
me a good day is when I wake up and it
doesn't feel like I've been socked in
the stomach
my husband Paul was killed in Iraq in
2006 emily was 8 years old
Caroline was 6 years old and Julia was 4
years old
things don't really make me like sad
anymore very much something to do but
the kid bullies me or something and I
don't really care because I've gone
through harder things than that under my
pillow every night I have a laminated
picture of him I still think about him
and sometimes they miss him when people
start talking about when their dads are
coming home or oh my dad's been away for
so long I miss him so much in the back
of my mind I'm kind of thinking suck it
up three months isn't as long as forever
I have more challenges with Julia now
than I did when she was four five and
six because the whole idea of death was
hard for her to understand now as she's
older she gets oh he's really not going
to be here
Caroline she was always attached to her
dad it took a good two years just to see
a smile on that child's face and Emily
just wanted things to be normal
she want to get back to school she
wanted to get back to her activities so
she did one thing that Paul's death has
muddied up for parenting is how much
sometimes some of this stuff is just
average kid stuff
teen stuff or girl stuff and how much of
it is okay this was this was about Paul
today I struggle and I try really hard
that his death doesn't define them I
don't want them ever to feel held back
by memories because memories can do that
sometimes even the best of memories
I don't want them to ever hesitate go oh
gosh but I need to be here for my and
maybe a part of me likes to hide behind
being so busy so I don't have to be so
sad I tell him I talked to your dad all
the time I'll say okay Paul what do I
need to do with this this is what your
daughter is facing what do we do I miss
my friend I miss my friend being here to
help raise our children together but I
think we seem to be doing okay I think
we're we're okay
you
